definition: to associate (with)/to have contact (with)/to hang out (with)/to date/(interpersonal) relationship/association/contact
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: They found that the higher their level of social interaction, the better their cognitive functioning.
sentences.chinese: 他們發現，社會交往越多的人認知表現越好。

sentences.english: His policy of overseas contacts was generally followed by his successors in Ming Dyn …
sentences.chinese: 明朝後代基本上沿用了太祖的海外交往政策。

sentences.english: This was probably the first time the Britons came into contact with other peoples.
sentences.chinese: 這或許是不列顛人第一次同外族人進行交往。

sentences.english: Eg. For years he refused to associate with Stephenson's staff.
sentences.chinese: 多年來，他一直拒絕同史蒂芬森手下的人交往。

sentences.english: Winners hangout with winners who are more successful than they are.
sentences.chinese: 成功者和比他們更成功的人交往。

sentences.english: Decide that friction will occasionally emerge in the course of human relationships, Stieber says.
sentences.chinese: 在人際交往中一定會偶爾出現摩擦，對這點要肯定。

sentences.english: What high-level exchanges have you had recently?
sentences.chinese: 雙方最近有哪些高層交往？

sentences.english: We encourage normal intercourse, and oppose love triangles.
sentences.chinese: 我們鼓勵正常的交往，反對三角戀愛。

sentences.english: Both Asia and Europe are cradles of human civilizations and have long been associated with each other.
sentences.chinese: 亞洲和歐洲都是人類文明的搖籃，相互交往源遠流長。

sentences.english: He has been consorting with known criminals.
sentences.chinese: 他一直與那些臭名昭著的罪犯有交往。

sentences.english: I'd advise you not to associate with him, he's a bad lot.
sentences.chinese: 我奉勸你不要和他交往，他是一個壞蛋。

sentences.english: Let your heart burn with loving-kindness for all who may cross your path.
sentences.chinese: 讓你的心對所有與你交往的人都燃燒這熊熊愛火。

sentences.english: This will not change - so you need to adopt this habit if you wish to have a long-term relationship.
sentences.chinese: 所以要是你想要同她們長久交往，你需要適應這一點。

sentences.english: Deploy your very best interpersonal communication skills.
sentences.chinese: 儘量發揮你的人際交往能力。

sentences.english: Remember that your goal is to build genuine relationships, so don’t approach people just because you think they can help to promote your blog.
sentences.chinese: 不要因爲博客才與人交往，要建立真正的人際關係。

sentences.english: The meaning of one's self-respect is expressed through its externalization of which the two main real paths are social practice and communication activity.
sentences.chinese: 人的社會實踐活動和交往活動是自尊外化的現實路徑。

definition: to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
to have sexual relations with sb/to have dealings with
to make friends/(dialect) to start an affair with sb
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
to get to know each other/acquaintance
emotion/sentiment/affection/feelings between two persons/CL:個|个[ge4],種|种[zhong3]
to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
to court/to go steady/to be dating
